New Records: Zach Neto is the first Angels infielder with a 20-homer, 20-steal season.
Key Match Events: Zach Neto hit a two-run home run in the fifth inning.
Jack Kochanowicz pitched six scoreless innings.
Detroit had runners on the corners with one out in the sixth, but Kochanowicz got Jace Jung to hit into a 4-6-3 double play.
Tigers reliever Joey Wentz had a tough seventh, getting hit by two hard comebackers in a span of three pitches.
Pre-Game Insights: Angels manager Ron Washington said he's proud of Jack Kochanowicz's improvement in his last four outings.
Post-Match Reflections: Zach Neto said he was finally able to put a good swing on a ball and get it out of the park after a three-for-26 (.115) slump.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels ended a seven-game losing streak with a 3-0 win over the Detroit Tigers.
The Angels return home for a three-game series with the Seattle Mariners.
Others: Left-hander Samuel Aldegheri will make his major-league debut in Friday's opener against right-hander George Kirby (9-10, 3.48).
The Angels also called up right-hander Caden Dana, the team's top prospect, and he will make his debut Sunday against the Mariners.
